title: A Second Major British Police Force Suffers a Cyberattack in Less Than a Month
description:
Personal details of thousands of police officers and staff from Greater Manchester Police have been hacked from a company that makes identity cards.

The post A Second Major British Police Force Suffers a Cyberattack in Less Than a Month appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Caesars Confirms Ransomware Hack, Stolen Loyalty Program Database
description:
The hijacked data includes driver’s license numbers and/or social security numbers from a Caesars Entertainment loyalty database.

The post Caesars Confirms Ransomware Hack, Stolen Loyalty Program Database appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: A One-Two Punch for Security ROI
description:
Cost avoidance is a powerful way to kick-off ROI discussions. However, to quickly move beyond objections, shifting to a more tangible approach to calculate ROI can help.

The post A One-Two Punch for Security ROI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: ICS Computers in Western Countries See Increasing Attacks: Report
description:
ICS computers in the Western world have been increasingly attacked, but the percentages are still small compared to other parts of the globe.   

The post ICS Computers in Western Countries See Increasing Attacks: Report appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Kubernetes Vulnerability Leads to Remote Code Execution
description:
A high-severity vulnerability can be exploited to execute code remotely on any Windows endpoint within a Kubernetes cluster.

The post Kubernetes Vulnerability Leads to Remote Code Execution appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Azure HDInsight Flaws Allowed Data Access, Session Hijacking, Payload Delivery
description:
Orca Security details eight XSS vulnerabilities in Azure HDInsight that could lead to information leaks, session hijacking, and payload delivery.

The post Azure HDInsight Flaws Allowed Data Access, Session Hijacking, Payload Delivery appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: LockBit Affiliate Deploys New 3AM Ransomware in Recent Attack
description:
A LockBit affiliate has deployed the new 3AM ransomware family on a victim’s network, after LockBit’s execution was blocked.

The post LockBit Affiliate Deploys New 3AM Ransomware in Recent Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: North Korean Hackers Steal $53 Million in Cryptocurrency From CoinEx
description:
North Korean hackers stole $53 million in cryptocurrency from crypto exchange CoinEx after the hot wallet private key was leaked.

The post North Korean Hackers Steal $53 Million in Cryptocurrency From CoinEx appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Ransomware Gang Takes Credit for Disruptive MGM Resorts Cyberattack
description:
A known ransomware gang has taken credit for the highly disruptive cyberattack on MGM Resorts, and the company has yet to restore impacted systems.

The post Ransomware Gang Takes Credit for Disruptive MGM Resorts Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Tech Industry Leaders Endorse Regulating Artificial Intelligence at Rare Summit in Washington
description:
Tech executives discussed the idea of government regulations for artificial intelligence (AI) at an unusual closed-door meeting in the U.S. Senate on September 13th.

The post Tech Industry Leaders Endorse Regulating Artificial Intelligence at Rare Summit in Washington appeared first on SecurityWeek.
